Getting or refreshing an access token
get.description:
The API needs an access token to responds favorably to requests. You can use the **password** directive to get one or **refresh_token** to refresh an expired one.
For more information on authentication, visit the [documentation](../../docs/auth/authentication)

grant_type.description:
Can be either 
 - **password**, to use with _username_ and _password_ 
 - **refresh_token**, to use with _refresh_token_

client_id.description: Scope used in keycloak, **don't change that**

username.description: Username used to authenticate the user

password.description: Username password, make sure to **always** pass it with _https_

refresh_token.description: Refresh token stored in browser's local storage

200.description:
### Authorized 
 Tokens :
 - *access_token*: the token issued by the server
 - *refresh_token*: token issued to renew access token without re-login
